intro: Brodiaea circinata, commonly known as the curlleaf brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its compact, grass-like foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually white or pale lavender and bloom in early spring. Brodiaea circinata is often found in California and is adapted to survive in arid conditions.
